channel.title: How to get 8mb broadband for free!
channel.description:
:eek: :eek: I have just got through bts hotline for broadband and i ordered there home hub with no phone. step 2. set it up manually cos you can't do it from cd cos u need a bt mail account and that would come if u payed for it:p now you have free broadband no charges for hub or even broadband :p @@@copyright runescape 4 life@@@@@@
sorry about spelling i'm on my wii

item.description:
@leader wrote:

[quote=“teh_hacker, post:16, topic:90073”]aol dial up gave my dad free internet for 2 years

every time he quit his free trial they extended it by another 3 months

they continued doing that for 2 years before they stopped[/quote]

That is because it is dial-up.

item.description:

[quote=“dedcar, post:1, topic:90073”]:eek: :eek: I have just got through bts hotline for broadband and i ordered there home hub with no phone. step 2. set it up manually cos you can’t do it from cd cos u need a bt mail account and that would come if u payed for it:p now you have free broadband no charges for hub or even broadband @@@copyright runescape 4 life@@@@@@

sorry about spelling i’m on my wii[/quote]

Wrong my friend, they scan the line every hour as it can sometimes take an hour to set the internet up, they then charge the x amount of pounds on your bill. They really are not that stupid.

basically they send you the stuff and activate it for free on the phone . I went to my m8s house and he ordered everything without entering any card details and I managed to get him connected to the internet even though he did’nt pay. There is basically a loop hole with there hub because you don’t need a password to connect[br][size=1]Posted on: May 06, 2007, 01:10:04 AM[/size][hr]I think you can only do it in england
